newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Tung, Morrison quit Hongkong Bank board.
newsitem.headline: Tung, Morrison quit Hongkong Bank board.

text.p: HSBC Holdings Plc's Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corp Ltd said on Tuesday it had accepted the resignations of bank directors, businessman Tung Chee-hwa, and Alasdair Morrison, the managing director of Jardine Matheson Holdings Ltd.
Tung quit to make himself available for the position of Chief Executive of the post-1997 Hong Kong administration, the bank said in a statement.
Morrison resigned following his appointment as chairman of the Jardine Fleming Supervisory Committee, the statement added.
Tung resigned on Friday from his position as chairman and chief executive officer of Orient Overseas (International) Ltd in order to bid for the job of Hong Kong's first post-colonial leader.

Hong Kong's future leader will be picked by a 400-strong selection board chosen by the Preparatory Committee responsible for overseeing the transition of Hong Kong from British colony to Chinese Special Administrative Region (SAR) at midnight on June 30, 1997.

The Jardine Fleming Supervisory Committee was established last month in the wake of a trading scandal over late allocation of trades which rocked the Hong Kong merchant bank's fund management division, Jardine Fleming Investment Management.
No further details were immediately available.
